intro: Kericodon crispus, commonly known as the curly kericodon, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, curling leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Kericodon crispus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas.
